revision.text:
{{Infobox journal | title = Landscape and Urban Planning | abbreviation = Landsc. Urban Plan. | image = File:Landscape and Urban Planning cover.gif | formernames = Landscape Planning | editor = Joan I. Nassauer, Wei-Ning Xiang | discipline = Landscape science, planning and design | former_name = Landscape Planning; Urban Ecology | publisher = [[Elsevier]] | country = | frequency = Monthly | history = 1974–present | openaccess = [[Hybrid open access journals|Hybrid]] | license = [[CC BY]] and [[CC BY-NC-ND]] | impact = 4.563 | impact-year = 2016 | website = https://www.journals.elsevier.com/landscape-and-urban-planning | link2 = https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/journal/01692046 | link2-name = Online archive | ISSN = 0169-2046 | OCLC = 643914016 | LCCN = 92643989 }} '''''Landscape and Urban Planning''''' is a monthly [[peer-reviewed]] [[academic journal]] published by [[Elsevier]]. It covers [[Landscape architecture|landscape science]], [[Landscape planning|planning]], [[Landscape design|design]], and [[Landscape architecture|architecture]], [[urban and regional planning]], [[Landscape engineering|landscape]] and [[ecological engineering]], [[Landscape ecology|landscape]] and [[urban ecology]], and other practice-oriented fields. The [[editors-in-chief]] are Joan I. Nassauer ([[University of Michigan]]) and Wei-Ning Xiang ([[Tongji University]]).
==History== The journal was established in 1974 as ''Landscape Planning'' under founding [[editor-in-chief]] Arnold E. Weddle. In 1986 the journal was renamed and merged with the journal ''Urban Ecology''. In 1988 the journal also incorporated ''Reclamation and Revegetation Research''.
==Editors-in-chief== The following persons are or have been editors-in-chief of the journal:<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/journal/01692046 |title=Landscape and Urban Planning |website=ScienceDirect |publisher=Elsevier || access-date=2018-01-05}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/landscape-planning/ |title=Landscape Planning |website=ScienceDirect |publisher=Elsevier |access-date=2018-01-05}}</ref> *Joan I. Nassauer ([[University of Michigan]]): July 2014–present *Wei-Ning Xiang ([[Tongji University]]): November 2011–present *Paul H. Gobster ([[United States Forest Service]]): October 2010–June 2014 *Jon E. Rodiek ([[Texas A&M University]]): 1991–September 2010 *Michael M. McCarthy ([[Texas A&M University]]): 1991–June 1992 *Arnold E. Weddle ([[University of Sheffield]]): 1974–1990
===Editors-in-chief of Urban Ecology=== The following persons have been editor-in-chief of ''Urban Ecology'':<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/urban-ecology |title=Urban Ecology |website=ScienceDirect |publisher=Elsevier |access-date=2018-01-05}}</ref> *[[Amos Rapoport]] ([[University of Wisconsin–Milwaukee]]): April 1981–1986 *Royce LaNier (University of Wisconsin–Milwaukee): 1975–March 1981
===Editors-in-chief of Reclamation and Revegetation Research=== The following persons have been editor-in-chief of ''Reclamation and Revegetation Research'': *Mohan K. Wali ([[University of North Dakota]]): 1982–1988 *Edward M. Watkin (Mine Waste Reclamation, Guelph, Ontario): 1983–1988
==Abstracting and indexing== The journal is [[Abstracting and indexing|abstracted and indexed]] in: {{columns-list|colwidth=30em| *[[BIOSIS Previews]]<ref name=ISI>{{cite web |url=http://mjl.clarivate.com/ |title=Master Journal List |publisher=[[Clarivate Analytics]] |work=Intellectual Property & Science |accessdate=2018-06-01}}</ref> *[[Cambridge Scientific Abstracts]] *[[Current Contents]]/Agriculture, Biology & Environmental Sciences<ref name=ISI/> *Current Contents/Social & Behavioral Sciences<ref name=ISI/> *[[GEOBASE]]<ref name=GEOBASE>{{cite web |url=http://www.elsevier.com/online-tools/engineering-village/contentdatabase-overview |title=Content/Database Overview - GEOBASE Source List |publisher=[[Elsevier]] |work=Engineering Village |accessdate=2018-06-01}}</ref> *[[Science Citation Index Expanded]]<ref name=ISI/> *[[Social Sciences Citation Index]]<ref name=ISI/> *[[Scopus]]<ref name=Scopus>{{cite web |url=https://www.scopus.com/sourceid/19041 |title=Source details: Landscape and Urban Planning |publisher=[[Elsevier]] |work=Scopus preview |accessdate=2018-06-01}}</ref> *[[Urban Studies Abstracts]] *[[The Zoological Record]]<ref name=ISI/> }} According to the ''[[Journal Citation Reports]]'', the journal has a 2016 [[impact factor]] of 4.563.<ref name=WoS>{{cite book |year=2017 |chapter=Landscape and Urban Planning |title=2016 [[Journal Citation Reports]] |publisher=[[Clarivate Analytics]] |edition=Science |series=[[Web of Science]]}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.elsevier.com/wps/find/journaldescription.cws_home/503347/description}}
[[Category:Landscape ecology]] [[Category:Landscape architecture]] [[Category:Urban planning]] [[Category:Urban design]] [[Category:English-language journals]] [[Category:Monthly journals]] [[Category:Elsevier academic journals]] [[Category:Creative Commons-licensed journals]] [[Category:Hybrid open access journals]] [[Category:Publications established in 1974]] [[Category:Urban studies and planning journals]]

{{Update|date=April 2018}} [[File:Alkoholersterwerbsalter (Weltweit)2.svg|thumb|500px|'''Minimum legal age to purchase alcohol by country:'''
{{legend|#000000|Illegal regardless of age}}{{legend|#441200|Minimum age is 25}}{{legend|#7F0000|Minimum age is 21}}{{legend|#FF0000|Minimum age is 20}}{{legend|#B200FF|Minimum age is 19}}{{legend|#0026FF|Minimum age is 18}}{{legend|#00FFFF|Minimum age is 17}}{{legend|#267F00|Minimum age is 16}}{{legend|#00FF00|Minimum age is 15}}{{legend|#B9B9B9|No regulation/no age set}}]] The '''legal drinking age''' is the age at which a person can [[legally]] consume [[alcoholic beverage]]s. These laws cover a wide range of issues and behaviors, addressing when and where alcohol can be consumed. The minimum age alcohol can be legally consumed can be different from the age when it can be purchased in some countries. These laws vary between different countries and many laws have exemptions or special circumstances. Most laws apply only to [[Drinking in public|drinking alcohol in public places]] with alcohol consumption in the home being mostly unregulated (an exception being the UK, which has a minimum legal age of five for supervised consumption in private places). Some countries also have different age limits for different [[List of alcoholic drinks|types of alcoholic drinks]].[http://www.icap.org/portals/0/download/all_pdfs/icap_reports_english/report4.pdf Drinking Age Limits] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130120062253/http://www.icap.org/portals/0/download/all_pdfs/icap_reports_english/report4.pdf |date=2013-01-20 }} - International Center for Alcohol Policies Kazakhstan, Oman, Pakistan, Qatar, Sri Lanka, Tajikistan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, Federated States of Micronesia, Palau, Paraguay, Solomon Islands, India (certain states), the United States (except U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico), Yemen (Aden and Sana'a), Japan, Iceland, Canada (certain Provinces and Territories), and South Korea have the highest set drinking ages; however, some of these countries do not have off-premises drinking limits. Austria, Antigua and Barbuda, Belgium, Bermuda, British Virgin Islands, Cuba, Ethiopia, Gibraltar, Luxembourg and Nicaragua have the lowest set drinking ages.{{synth|date=October 2018}} The most commonly known reason for the law behind the legal drinking age is the [[Long-term impact of alcohol on the brain|effect on the brain]] in adolescents. Since the brain is still maturing, alcohol can have a [[Effects of alcohol on memory|negative effect on the memory]] and long-term thinking. Alongside that, it can cause [[Alcoholic liver disease|liver failure]], and create a [[Long-term effects of alcohol consumption#Hormonal Imbalance|hormone imbalance]] in teens due to the constant changes and maturing of hormones during [[puberty]].{{Cite web |url=https://pubs.niaaa.nih.gov/publications/AA67/AA67.htm |title=Underage Drinking |publisher=National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism |date=January 2006 |access-date=13 May 2018}} ==Africa== [[File:Drinking age Africa.svg|thumb|230px|'''Minimum legal age to purchase alcohol by country:'''
{{legend|#000000|Illegal}}{{legend|#7F0000|Minimum purchase age of 21 years}}{{legend|#0026FF|Minimum purchase age of 18 years}}{{legend|#00FFDD|Minimum purchase age of 17 years}}{{legend|#267F00|Minimum purchase age of 16 years}}{{legend|#00FF00|Minimum purchase age of 15 years}}{{legend|#808080|No minimum purchase age}}]] The most common minimum age to purchase alcohol in Africa is 18. Although it varies from the lowest age limit in Ethiopia being only 15 years, Zimbabwe with a minimum purchase age of 16 years, The Gambia with an age limit of 17 years, and Uganda where the minimum legal purchase age is 18 but minors aged 16 or 17 may consume a glass of beer, wine or cider with a meal at a restaurant. Cameroon and Egypt are the only countries in Africa with a minimum purchase age of 21 years. However Algeria, Angola (except Luando Province), Central African Republic, Comoros, Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, Guinea-Bissau, Morocco, Togo, Tunisia and the Western Sahara have no laws on the book restricting the sale of alcohol to minors. In Libya, Somalia and Sudan the sale, production and consumption of alcohol is completely prohibited.{{synth|date=October 2018}} {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:75%;" |- ! rowspan=2 style="width:15%;"| Country ! rowspan=2 style="width:15%;"| State/region/province ! colspan=2 style="width:30%;"| [[De jure|''De jure'']] ! rowspan=2 style="width:40%;"| Notes |- ! style="width:15%;"| Drinking age ! style="width:15%;"| Purchase age |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Algeria}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| None (illegal to all persons){{cite web|url=http://www.africanchildforum.org/clr/Harmonisation%20of%20Laws%20in%20Africa/other-documents-harmonisation_8_en.pdf|title=PROTECTION FROM DRUG ABUSE/ MINIMUM AGE FOR SALE OF ALCOHOL AND DRUGS: INTERNATIONAL AND REGIONAL LAWS|publisher=The African Child Policy Forum|accessdate=12 March 2018}} |Illegal to sell, produce or consume alcohol at any age. |- | rowspan="2"| {{flag|Angola}} | | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" | None (legal at any age) | There is no national legislation prohibiting the sale of alcohol to minors. |- |[[Luanda Province]] | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" | 18{{cite web|url=http://www.luanda.gov.ao/verlegislacao.aspx?id=434|title=Sobre o acesso de menores a espectáculos nocturnos, e o consumo e a comercialização de bebidas alcoólicas por menores|publisher=Governo Provincial de Luanda|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | Legislation in [[Luanda Province]]: It is illegal to sell alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18. It is also illegal for minors to buy and consume alcohol. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Botswana}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=https://www.a-mla.org/images/acts/LIQOUR%20ACT,%202004.pdf.pdf|title=Liquor Act 2008 - Section 32|publisher=Government of Botswana|accessdate=12 March 2018}} (illegal for any person to supply) | align="center" |18 | It is illegal for any person with a liquor license to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 18 years. Because the law only applies to licensees, it is not illegal for minors to buy, consume, or possess alcoholic beverages. It is also illegal for any person to expose or supply alcohol to a minor under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Burundi}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=https://ihl-databases.icrc.org/applic/ihl/ihl-nat.nsf/0/cb9d300d8db9fc37c125707300338af2/$FILE/Code%20P%C3%A9nal%20du%20Burundi%20.pdf|title=Code Pénal du Burundi - Article 501 et 502|publisher=MINISTRE DE LA JUSTICE ET GARDE|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | align="center" |18, or none (if accompanied by parent or legal guardian) | It is illegal for any person with a liquor license to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to unaccompanied minors under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Cameroon}} | align="center" colspan="2"| 21, or 18 (if accompanied by a person 21 years of age or older){{cite web|url=http://www.wipo.int/wipolex/fr/text.jsp?file_id=425156|title=Law No. 2016/007 of July 12, 2016, relating to the Penal Code - Section 348|publisher=|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | It is illegal for any person with a liquor license to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under 18 years of age. The law permits adults from the ages 18 to 21 to consume, purchase and buy alcoholic beverages if accompanied by a person 21 years of age or older. Anyone over the age of 21 years may buy or consume alcohol unaccompanied. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Cape Verde}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=https://www.minsaude.gov.cv/index.php/documentosite/342-1-plano-alcool-b-o-i-serie-n-29-de-18-de-abril-de-2016/file|title=Lei n.° 27/V/97|publisher=Imprensa Nacional de Cabo Verde|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal for any person to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Central African Republic}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 15 (off-premises), or 21 (on-premises){{Cite web|url=http://www.who.int/substance_abuse/publications/global_alcohol_report/profiles/caf.pdf|title=WHO Global Alcohol Report Central African Republic|last=|first=|date=2014|website=World Health Organization|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 October 2018}} |It is illegal for any person to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 15 years when sold or supplied off-premises (e.g., liquor stores, wine stores, and supermarkets). It is illegal for any person to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 21 years when sold or supplied on-premises (e.g., restaurants, bars, and cafes). |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Comoros}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 18{{Cite web|url=http://www.who.int/substance_abuse/publications/global_alcohol_report/profiles/com.pdf|title=WHO Global Alcohol Report Comoros|last=|first=|date=2014|website=World Health Organization|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 October 2018}} |It is illegal for any person to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Egypt}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 21 | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Equatorial Guinea}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 21{{Cite web|url=http://www.who.int/substance_abuse/publications/global_alcohol_report/profiles/gnq.pdf|title=WHO Global Alcohol Reportal Equatorial Guinea|last=|first=|date=2014|website=World Health Organization|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 October 2018}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Eritrea}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=https://www.unodc.org/res/cld/document/penal-code_html/PENAL_CODE_ERITREA.pdf|title=Penal Code of Eritrea - Article 267|publisher=United Nations Office on Drugs and Crimes|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal for any person to sell or serve alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Ethiopia}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://www.wipo.int/edocs/lexdocs/laws/en/et/et011en.pdf|title=Criminal Code, 2004 - Article 531 & 818|publisher=WIPO|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | align="center" |15 | It is illegal for any person to sell, offer, serve or allow to serve alcoholic beverages "in substantial quantities" to any infant or young person. The criminal code defines a young person as any person under the age of 15 years. But the Criminal Code states: "Whoever endangers the health of another, intentionally and unscrupulously, by administering or serving, or by causing or permitting to be administered or served, to minors (defined as anyone under the age of 18 years) (...) alcoholic beverages or spirituous liquors of such kind or in such quantity as to make their injurious effect certain or probable, is punishable with simple imprisonment not exceeding one year, and fine." |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Gabon}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 18 (on-premises only){{Cite web|url=http://www.who.int/substance_abuse/publications/global_alcohol_report/profiles/gab.pdf|title=WHO Global Alcohol Report|last=|first=|date=2014|website=World Health Organization|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=18 October 2018}} |It is illegal for any person to sell or supply alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 18 years when sold or supplied on-premises (e.g., restaurants, bars, and cafes). |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Gambia}} | align="center" | None{{cite web|url=http://www.refworld.org/cgi-bin/texis/vtx/rwmain?page=search&docid=3df5a6d17&skip=0&query=liquor&coi=GMB|title=Drug Control Decree and Decree No. 80 of 1996|publisher=UN Committee on the Rights of the Child (CRC)|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | align="center" | 17 | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to child or young person. A "young person" is defined as anyone under the age of 17 by the Children and Young Persons Act, 1949 Section 2. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Ghana}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 18{{cite web|url=http://laws.ghanalegal.com/acts/id/87/section/15/Young_Persons_To_Be_Excluded|title=LIQUOR LICENSING ACT - 1970 (ACT 331) - Section 15 - Young Persons to be Excluded.|publisher=Ghana Legal|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Guinea-Bissau}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| None | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Kenya}} | align="center" | None{{cite web|url=http://kenyalaw.org/kl/fileadmin/pdfdownloads/Acts/Alcoholic_Drinks_Control_Act__No4of2010.pdf|title=ALCOHOLIC DRINKS CONTROL ACT - SECTION 28|publisher=National Council for Law Reporting|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | align="center" | 18 | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Lesotho}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 18{{cite web|url=https://www.lesothotradeportal.org.ls/index.php?r=site/display&id=57#39|title=LIQUOR LICENSING ACT 1998 - Section 39|publisher=Ministry of Tourism Environment and Culture|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply any alcoholic beverage to a minor under the age of 18 years. It is also illegal for minors to consume, buy or attempt to buy alcohol. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Liberia}} | align="center" | None | align="center" | 18 | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Libya}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| Illegal{{cite web|url=http://security-legislation.ly/node/33464|title=Penal Code - Article (21) of Law No. (89) of 1974 prohibiting alcohol and establish the hudud punishment for drinking|publisher=Geneva Centre for the Democratic Control of Armed Forces|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | Previously Article 498 of the Libyan Penal Code prohibted the sale of alcoholic beverages to juveniles under the age of 16 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Malawi}} | align="center" | None | align="center" | 18{{cite web|url=http://www.africanchildinfo.net/clr/Legislation%20Per%20Country/Malawi/malawi_liquor_1979_en.pdf|title=Liquor Act -Section 74|publisher=The African Child Information Hub|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Mauritius}} | align="center" | None | align="center" | 18{{cite web|url=http://dpp.govmu.org/English/Documents/Legislation/CHILD%20PROTECTION.pdf|title=Child Protection Act, 1995 Section 16|publisher=Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Morocco}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| None | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Mozambique}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"| 18{{cite web|url=http://jornaldomingo.co.mz/index.php/sociedade/2053-sancoes-duras-para-infractores-do-novo-regulamento|title=Sanções duras para infractores do novo regulamento|publisher=Domingo|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Namibia}} | align="center" | None | align="center" | 18{{cite web|url=http://www.lac.org.na/laws/annoREG/Liquor%20Act%206%20of%201998%20-%20Regulations%202001-142%20(annotated).pdf|title=Liquor Act 6 of 1998 |publisher= Legal Assistance Centre|accessdate=12 March 2018}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Niger}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan=2| 18 | |- | {{legend|#7F0000|Minimum purchase age of 21 years}}{{legend|#B200FF|Minimum purchase age of 19 years}}{{legend|#0026FF|Minimum purchase age of 18 years}}]] [[File:Alkoholersterwerbsalter in Zentralamerika und der Karibik.png|thumb|230px|'''Minimum legal age to purchase alcohol by country:'''
{{legend|#0026FF|Minimum purchase age of 18 years}}{{legend|#267F00|Minimum purchase age of 16 years}}]] [[File:Drinking age South America.svg|thumb|230px|'''Minimum legal age to purchase alcohol by country:'''
{{legend|#FF0000|Minimum purchase age of 20 years}}{{legend|#0026FF|Minimum purchase age of 18 years}}]] The minimum age to purchase and consume varies, but the most common age is 18 years. However, in [[North America]] the age limits varies between 18 and 21 years of age. Throughout the [[United States]] the minimum legal age to purchase any alcoholic beverage from a shop, supermarket, liquor store, bar, club or any other licensed premises is 21 years of age. In [[Canada]] each province can decide which minimum age limit is to be set to buy or consume alcohol. Most provinces have a minimum age of 19 years, while [[Alberta]], [[Manitoba]] and [[Quebec]] have set a minimum age of 18 years. In [[South America]] all countries have set a minimum purchase age of 18 years, except for [[Guyana]] where minors aged 16 or 17 may consume a glass of beer, wine or cider in a restaurant provided they buy a meal, and [[Paraguay]] the only country with a minimum legal purchase and drinking age of 20 years. {| class="wikitable sortable mw-collapsible" style="width:75%;" |- ! rowspan=2 style="width:15%;"| Country ! rowspan=2 style="width:15%;"| State/region/province ! colspan=2 style="width:30%;"| [[De jure]] ! rowspan=2 style="width:40%;"| Notes |- ! style="width:15%;"| Drinking age ! style="width:15%;"| Purchase age |- | colspan=2|''{{flag|Anguilla}}'' | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://www.gov.ai/laws/L075-00-Liquor%20Licences%20Act/|title=L075-00-Liquor Licences Act - 27. |publisher=Government of Anguilla|accessdate=18 March 2018}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal to sell or serve alcoholic drinks to anyone under the age of 18 years. Violating the regulation is punished with a $9.600 fine. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Antigua and Barbuda}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |16{{cite web |url=http://www.laws.gov.ag/acts/chapters/cap-249.pdf |publisher=laws.gov.ag |title=THE LICENSING (INTOXICATING LIQUOR) ACT - CHAPTER 249 - PART V - 24. |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | The sale and distribution of alcohol to a person under 16 years of age is illegal. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Argentina}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://infoleg.gov.ar/infolegInternet/anexos/40000-44999/42480/norma.htm |date=31 March 1997 |language=Spanish |title=Ley Nacional De Lucha Contra El Alcoholismo |accessdate=2013-01-08}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Bahamas}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://laws.bahamas.gov.bs/cms/images/LEGISLATION/PRINCIPAL/2007/2007-0001/ChildProtectionAct_1.pdf |publisher=Government of the Bahamas |title=CHILD PROTECTION ACT - PART VI - CARE AND PROTECTION OF CHILDREN SUPERVISION ORDERS - 62. (4) |accessdate=18 March 2018}} | It is illegal for any adult to sell, serve or supply any alcoholic beverage to a child (defined as anyone under the age of 18 years). The law provides an exception to treat an illness in urgent cases or upon order by a medical doctor. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Barbados}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |16{{cite news |url=https://www.barbadosadvocate.com/news/raise-drinking-age |publisher=BARBADOS ADVOCATE |title=RAISE DRINKING AGE |accessdate=18 March 2018}} | It is illegal to sell or serve any alcoholic beverage to anyone under the age of 16 years. The President of the Barbados Road Safety Association is trying to raise the drinking age to 18 years because the law is often violated. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Belize}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://www.ird.gov.vg/Portals/0/Liquor%20Licences%20Act%20%28Cap.%20106%29.pdf |publisher=ird.gov.vg |title=Liquor Licences Act (Cap. 106) - PART IV - 34: Sale of intoxicating liquor to children. |accessdate=2015-01-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150103005633/http://www.ird.gov.vg/Portals/0/Liquor%20Licences%20Act%20%28Cap.%20106%29.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-03 |df= }} |Drinking age is rarely enforced. IDs are almost never requested. |- | colspan=2| ''{{flag|Bermuda}}'' | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://www.cada.bm/images/articles/Bermuda_Liquor_Licence_Act_1974_-_with_2010_amendments_incorporated.pdf |publisher=cada.bm |title=LIQUOR LICENCE ACT 1974 - Procuring drink for drunken person or minor 42. |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | It is illegal to sell or serve any alcoholic beverage to a child under the age of 18 years. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Bolivia}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18 | It is illegal to sell or serve alcoholic beverages to minors under the age of 18 years. Every sold alcoholic beverage has to have a warning message on the bottle or container reading: “VENTA PROHIBIDA A MENORES DE 18 AÑOS DE EDAD” (Sale prohibited to (anyone) under 18 years of age) and “EL CONSUMO EXCESIVO DE ALCOHOL ES DAÑINO PARA LA SALUD” (Excessive alcohol consumption is harmful to (ones) health). |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Brazil}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/_ato2015-2018/2015/lei/l13106.htm |title=LEI Nº 13.106, DE 17 DE MARÇO DE 2015. Art. 1o, Art. 2o |publisher=Presidência da República Casa Civil|accessdate=18 March 2018}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply any alcoholic beverage to a person under 18 years of age. The presidential law enacted on March 17, 2015 made any violation of the law a criminal offence. Any adult person selling, serving, giving or supplying alcoholic beverages to a minor is punished with imprisonment of 2 to 4 years, a fine of R$3.000 to R$10.000 and a ban to operate any business selling or serving alcohol. |- | colspan=2| ''{{flag|British Virgin Islands}}'' | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|16 | It is illegal to sell or to supply alcohol to anyone under the age of 16. |- | rowspan=2| {{flag|Canada}} | {{flag|Alberta}}
{{flag|Manitoba}}
{{flag|Quebec}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18 | In Alberta no person may give or sell or permit any person to give or sell liquor to a minor in licensed premises.{{cite web|url=http://www.qp.alberta.ca/documents/Acts/g01.pdf |title=GAMING AND LIQUOR ACT - Supplying liquor to minor - 75 |publisher=Alberta Queen’s Printer|accessdate=18 March 2018}} In Manitoba a person must not give, sell or otherwise supply liquor to a minor. the law provides exceptions for a doctor, dentist, pharmacist or other health care professional for medical purposes; for sacramental purposes and by the parent, guardian, spouse or common-law partner, if it is given or supplied in a residence.{{cite web|url=http://web2.gov.mb.ca/laws/statutes/ccsm/l153e.php |title=The Liquor and Gaming Control Act - No providing liquor to minors - 62 (1) and (2)|publisher=Manitoba Queen’s Printer|accessdate=18 March 2018}} In Quebec the law probits the sale of alcoholic beverages to a minor under the age of 18 years.{{cite web|url=http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/ShowDoc/cs/P-9.1 |title=ACT RESPECTING LIQUOR PERMITS|publisher=Gouvernement du Québec|accessdate=18 March 2018}} |- | {{flag|Ontario}}
{{flag|Saskatchewan}}
{{flag|British Columbia}}
{{flag|Newfoundland and Labrador}}
{{flag|Nova Scotia}}
{{flag|New Brunswick}}
{{flag|Prince Edward Island}}
{{flag|Northwest Territories}}
{{flag|Yukon}}
{{flag|Nunavut}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|19 | Ontario's [[Liquor Licence Act (Ontario)|Liquor Licence Act]] permits the supply and consumption of liquor to those under the age of 19. However, supplying a person under the age of 19 is restricted to the person's parent, or legal guardian, and may only occur in a residence or in a private place of the parent or legal guardian. A person under the age of 19 who was supplied liquor in this manner is permitted to consume the liquor only in the place it was supplied.{{cite web|url=https://www.ontario.ca/laws/statute/90l19#BK34|title=Liquor Licence Act, R.S.O. 1990, c. L.19 s.30 Rules, persons under 19|publisher=Queen's Printer for Ontario|accessdate=16 October 2018}} |- | colspan=2| ''{{flag|Cayman Islands}}'' | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://www.gov.ky/pls/portal/docs/PAGE/CIGHOME/FIND/ORGANISATIONS/AZAGENCIES/POL/INFORMATIONGUIDES/FREQUENTLYCONSULTEDLAWS/LIQUOR2000.PDF |publisher=gov.ky |title=LIQUOR LICENSING LAW - 21., 22. |accessdate=2015-01-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150912014454/http://www.gov.ky/pls/portal/docs/PAGE/CIGHOME/FIND/ORGANISATIONS/AZAGENCIES/POL/INFORMATIONGUIDES/FREQUENTLYCONSULTEDLAWS/LIQUOR2000.PDF |archivedate=2015-09-12 |df= }} | It is prohibited to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. It is also illegal for any minor to buy, attempt to buy or consume alcoholic beverages. Violation of the lawis punished with a fine of five thousand dollars, and the court may, if the offence was committed by the licensee, order that the licensee shall forfeit his licence and that no licence may be issued to that person for a period not exceeding ten years from the date of his conviction. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Chile}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web|title=Minimum Legal Age Limits|url=http://www.iard.org/policy-tables/minimum-legal-age-limits/|website=IARD|accessdate=15 June 2016}} | The minimum age is 18 to enter an enclosure that sells alcoholic beverages. Selling alcohol to a minor may incur a fine. One must provide identification upon request. Residents of Chile over the age of 18 must carry their [[identity card#Chile|Chilean identification card]] issued by the Civil Registry and Identification Service at all times.{{cite web |url=https://www.leychile.cl/Navegar?idNorma=220208 |title=LAW ON EXPENDITURE AND CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES |language=Spanish |accessdate=7 September 2017}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Colombia}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web |url=http://www.alcaldiabogota.gov.co/sisjur/normas/Norma1.jsp?i=291 |publisher=Secretaría Jurídica Distrital de la Alcaldía Mayor de Bogotá D.C |title=LEY 124 DE 1994 - Artículo 1º. |accessdate=18 March 2018}} | The law prohibits the sale of alcohol to a minor (anyone under the age of 18 years). It is not illegal for minors to buy, attempt to buy or consume alcohol. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Costa Rica}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web |url=http://www.tse.go.cr/pdf/normativa/leyderegulaciondehorarios.pdf |publisher=Secretaría Jurídica Distrital de la Alcaldía Mayor de Bogotá D.C |title=Ley n.º 7633 - REGULACIÓN DE HORARIOS DE FUNCIONAMIENTO EN EXPENDIOS DE BEBIDAS ALCOHÓLICAS - ARTÍCULO 5.-|accessdate=18 March 2018}} | The law prohibits the sale of alcohol to a minor (anyone under the age of 18 years). Selling alcohol to a minor will be punished with a fine equivalent to ten basic salaries. Whoever permits minors to maintain in any establishment which main purpose is to sell alcoholic beverages, will be sanctioned with a fine equivalent to five salaries. It is not illegal for minors to buy, attempt to buy or consume alcohol. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Cuba}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |16{{cite web|url=https://www.gacetaoficial.gob.cu/html/ipenal.html |publisher=gacetaoficial.gob.cu |title=CODIGO PENAL - ARTICULO 313.1.- |accessdate=18 March 2018}} | The penal code prohibits any adult to induce any young person under the age of 16 years, to habitually consume alcoholic beverages. The law obligates establishments to place a visible notice at the point of sale and to check identification to enforce the law. However it is not illegal for minors to buy, attempt to buy or consume alcohol. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|El Salvador}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=https://sansalvador.gob.sv/phocadownload/userupload/Sindicatura/LEY-REGULADORA-DE-LA-PRODUCCION-Y-COMERCIALIZACION-DE-ALCOHOL-Y-BEBIDAS-ALCOHOLICAS.pdf |publisher=Gobierno de San Salvador |title=LEY REGULADORA DE LA PRODUCCION Y COMERCIALIZACION DEL ALCOHOL Y DE LAS BEBIDAS ALCOHOLICAS - Art. 49.-|accessdate=18 March 2018}} | It is strictly prohibited to sell or serve alcoholic beverages to a minor under the age of 18 years. Parents may permit their children to consume alcohol on private premises. Minors consuming alcohol in public are committing a criminal offence. The law provides exceptions for the consumption of alcohol by minors for prescription of or at the direction of a government medical officer or in the course of the administration of Holy Communion according to the rites of any Christian denomination. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Grenada}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://www.granada.org/inet/wordenanz.nsf/wwbusmta/D0D39EF5880FED62C12572E2001C3E6F |publisher=Ayuntamiento de Granada |title=Ordenanza reguladora de determinadas actividades de ocio en el término municipal de Granada |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply any alcoholic drink to a minor under 18 years of age. Minors under 18 years are prohibited by law, to consume alcoholic beverages in public. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Guatemala}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web |url=http://www.bvsde.paho.org/bvsacd/cd38/Guatemala/D90-97.pdf |publisher=EL CONGRESO DE LA REPUBLICA DE GUATEMALA |title=DECRETO NUMERO 90-97 - ARTICULO 50. |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply any alcoholic drink to a minor under 18 years of age. Every point of sale or establishment serving alcohol, is required to post a notice stating that the sale of alcohol to minors under 18 years of age is illegal. However the law permits children as young as 14 to purchase and consume alcohol in a restaurant without further restrictions. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Panama}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=http://extwprlegs1.fao.org/docs/pdf/pan41786.pdf |publisher=Consejo Nacional de Legislación |title=EL CONSFJO NACIONAL DE LEGISLACION DECRETA: CAPITULO PRIMERO IMPUESTOS SOBRE EXPENDIO DE BEBIDAS ALCOHOLICAS. |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Paraguay}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|20{{cite web|url=http://www.portalguarani.com/1692_legislacion_paraguaya_de_la_ninez_y_la_adolescencia/13648_ley_n_1642__2000__que_prohibe_la_venta_debebidas_alcoholicas_a_menores_de_edad_y_prohibe_su_consumo_en_la_via_publica.html |title=Ley N° 1.642 / 2000 - QUE PROHÍBE LA VENTA DEBEBIDAS ALCOHÓLICAS A MENORES DE EDAD Y PROHÍBE SU CONSUMO EN LA VÍA PÚBLICA |publisher=portalguarani.com |date= |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | According to Art. 1° of the law to "ban on the sale of alcoholic beverages to minors", it is illegal to serve or sell alcohol or to allow the consumption by minors under 20 years of age. Furthermore, under Art 2° all public establishments selling alcohol must display a clearly legible notice in the sales area with the following text: "ESTA PROHIBIDA LA VENTA DE BEBIDAS ALCOHÓLICAS A MENORES DE VEINTE AÑOS DE EDAD" (It is illegal (prohibited) to sell alcoholic beverages to minors under 20 years of age) |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Peru}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=https://docs.peru.justia.com/federales/leyes/28681-mar-3-2006.pdf |publisher=docs.peru.justia.com |title=Ley No. 28681 |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | |- | colspan=2| ''{{flag|Puerto Rico}}'' | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18 | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines}} | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|16{{Cite web|url=http://www.who.int/substance_abuse/publications/global_alcohol_report/profiles/vct.pdf?ua=1|title=S a i n t Vi n c e n t a n d t h e G r e n a d i n e s|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Trinidad and Tobago}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=http://rgd.legalaffairs.gov.tt/laws2/alphabetical_list/lawspdfs/84.10.pdf |title=Liquor Licenses Act - Section 60|accessdate=2015-01-09}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholiv beverages to child under the age of 18 years. It is also illegal for an adult to send a child to buy alcohol on behalf. It is not illegal for children to buy or consume alcohol. |- | colspan=2| ''{{flag|Turks and Caicos Islands}}'' | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=http://online.fliphtml5.com/fizd/micd/#p=22 |title=Liquor Licenses Act - Section 27|accessdate=2015-01-09}} | It is illegal to serve or sell liquor to a young person under the age of eighteen years. Minors under the age of sixteen years may not present in a licensed premises mainly serving and selling alcoholic beverages. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|United States}}
(50 states and integral territories) | style="text-align:center;" |Varies by jurisdiction | style="text-align:center;" |21 | The [[National Minimum Drinking Age Act of 1984]] withholds revenue from states that allow the purchase of alcohol by anyone under the age of 21. Prior to the effective date of that Act, the [[U.S. history of alcohol minimum purchase age by state|drinking age varied from state to state]]. Some [[U. S. state|states]] do not allow those under the legal drinking age to be present in liquor stores or in [[bar (establishment)|bars]] (usually, the difference between a bar and a [[restaurant]] is that food is served only in the latter). Contrary to popular belief, since the act went into law, only a few states prohibit [[minor (law)|minors]] and [[youth|young adults]] from consuming alcohol in private settings. As of January 1, 2010, 15 states and the [[District of Columbia]] ban underage consumption outright, 17 states do not ban underage consumption, and the remaining 18 states have family member or location exceptions to their underage consumption laws. Federal law explicitly provides for religious exceptions. As of 2005, 31 states have family member or location exceptions to their underage possession laws. However, non-alcoholic beer in many (but not all) states, such as [[Idaho]], [[Texas]], and [[Maryland]], is considered legal for those under the age of 21.[http://alcoholpolicy.niaaa.nih.gov/Underage_Possession_Consumption_Internal_Possession_of_Alcohol.html?tab=Maps Exceptions to Minimum Age of 21 for Possession of Alcohol as of January 1, 2009] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721055504/http://www.alcoholpolicy.niaaa.nih.gov/underage_possession_consumption_internal_possession_of_alcohol.html?tab=maps |date=2011-07-21 }}, Alcohol Policy Information System By a judge's ruling, [[South Carolina]] appears to allow the possession and consumption of alcohol by adults 18 to 20 years of age, but a circuit court judge has said otherwise.{{cite web|url=http://www.wmbfnews.com/Global/story.asp?S=10726099|title=Judge: State law barring underage drinking is unconstitutional|date=14 July 2009|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} The states of Washington and Wisconsin allows the consumption of alcohol in the presence of parents. Some U.S. states have legislation that make providing to and possession of alcohol by persons under twenty-one a gross misdemeanor with a potential penalty of a $5,000 fine or up to a year in jail.{{cite web |url=http://apps.leg.wa.gov/rcw/default.aspx?cite=66.44.270 |publisher= State of Washington |author=Washington State Legislature |title=RCW 66.44.270; Furnishing liquor to minors |accessdate=2013-01-08}} {{See also|Minor in Possession|List of alcohol laws of the United States}} |- | colspan=2| ''{{flag|United States Virgin Islands}}'' | colspan=2 style="text-align:center;"|18{{cite web|url=http://www.vinow.com/general_usvi/faq/#drinking |title=Helpful Visitor Information for the Virgin Islands |publisher=Vinow.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-11}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Uruguay}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=https://www.elobservador.com.uy/legisladores-quieren-prohibir-que-menores-18-consuman-bebidas-alcoholicas-n1044893 |title=Legisladores quieren prohibir que menores de 18 consuman bebidas alcohólicas|accessdate=2015-01-09}} | Only selling alcohol to minors under the age of 18 is prohibited, consumption and purchase by minors is not illegal. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Venezuela}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=https://members.wto.org/crnattachments/2008/tbt/per/08_3081_00_s.pdf |title=REGLAMENTO DE LA LEY N° 28681, LEY QUE REGULA LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN, CONSUMO Y PUBLICIDAD DE BEBIDAS ALCOHÓLICAS - Artículo 14°|accessdate=2015-01-09}} | Only selling alcohol to minors under the age of 18 is prohibited, consumption and purchase by minors is not illegal. |} ==Asia== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:90%;" |- ! 18 (public places e.g. bars and restaurants) | align="center"|18 |It is an offense to sell alcohol to minors. Anyone caught selling or furnishing alcohol in any licensed premise to persons below 18 can be fined up to $5000. It is also illegal for minors to purchase, or attempt to purchase alcohol from any licensed premise, in which the minors can also be fined up to $5000. However, the authorities rarely enforced this on minors. It is technically legal for minors to possess and consume alcohol at home and in public as there is no law prohibiting it. {{legend|#FF0000|Minimum purchase age of 20 years}}{{legend|#0026FF|Minimum purchase age of 18 years}}{{legend|#00FFDD|Minimum purchase age of 17 years}}{{legend|#267F00|Minimum purchase age of 16 years}}]] [[File:Konsumverbot.svg|thumb|500px|'''Laws banning minors from consuming alcohol in public/private:'''
{{legend|#FF0000|Minimum age to consume alcohol in public and private}}{{legend|#FFD800|Minimum age to consume alcohol in public}}{{legend|#267F00|No minimum age to consume alcohol in public or private}}]] Most countries within [[Europe]] have set 18 as the minimum age to purchase alcohol. Although [[Austria]], [[Belgium]], [[Cyprus]], [[Denmark]], [[Germany]], [[Gibraltar]], [[Liechtenstein]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Malta]], [[Serbia]] and [[Switzerland]] (except [[Ticino]]) maintain a minimum purchase age below 18 years permitting minors either full or limited access to alcohol. In 2005,{{cite news |url=http://www.rp-online.de/politik/deutschland/eu-will-alkoholkauf-erst-ab-18-erlauben-aid-1.1607191 |title=EU will Alkoholkauf erst ab 18 erlauben |author=AFP, dpa |date=26 February 2005 |language=de |website=www.rp-online.de |access-date=23 March 2018}} 2007{{cite news |url=https://www.abendblatt.de/politik/europa/article107217172/Die-EU-will-Alkohol-erst-ab-18-Jahren-freigeben.html |title=Die EU will Alkohol erst ab 18 Jahren freigeben |author=AFP, dpa |date=13 March 2007 |language=de |website=www.abendblatt.de |access-date=23 March 2018}} and recently in 2015{{cite news |url=https://www.welt.de/politik/ausland/article140181484/EU-Parlament-will-Alkohol-unter-18-verbieten.html |title=EU-Parlament will Alkohol unter 18 verbieten |author=Christoph B. Schiltz |date=27 April 2015 |language=de |website=www.welt.de/politik |access-date=23 March 2018}} the [[European Union]] has failed to enact a law forcing member states to raise their purchase age to 18 years. But in the past years several European countries have raised their drinking/purchase age or enacted laws restricting the access to alcohol for minors: * In 2002 the autonomous communities [[Madrid]],{{cite web |url=http://www.elinconformistadigital.com/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=56 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20150408124810/http://www.elinconformistadigital.com/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=56 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2015-04-08 |title=La ley seca aprobada en Madrid |author=Marlowe |date=2002-03-07 |language=es |website=elinconformistadigital.com |access-date=2015-04-07 }} [[Valencia]]{{cite web |url=http://www.joves.net/estas-d-acord/augmentar-l-edat-per-a-consumir-alcohol |title=El Conseller Blasco propone aumentar la edad legal para el consumo de alcohol |date=2002 |language=es |website=joves.net |access-date=2015-04-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150414042742/http://www.joves.net/estas-d-acord/augmentar-l-edat-per-a-consumir-alcohol |archivedate=2015-04-14 |df= }} and [[Catalonia]]{{cite web |url=http://www.lasdrogas.info/noticias/453/cataluna-eleva-hasta-los-18-anos-la-edad-minima-para-poder-comprar-alcohol.html |title=Cataluña eleva hasta los 18 años la edad mínima para poder comprar alcohol |date=2002-02-28 |language=es |website=lasdrogas.info |access-date=2015-04-07}} raised their minimum purchase age to 18 years. Previous to 2002 Valencia and Madrid had a minimum purchase age of 16 years, and in Catalonia minors aged 16 or 17 could purchase alcohol up to 23% ABV on and off premises. * In 2004 [[Denmark]]{{cite web |url=http://www.si-folkesundhed.dk/Ugens%20tal%20for%20folkesundhed/Ugens%20tal/Uge_12_2006.aspx |title=Forbud mod salg af alkohol til personer under 16 år – virker det? |date=2006 |language=Danish|website=si-folkesundhed.dk |page=København: Statens Institut for Folkesundhed |publisher=Jørgensen MH, Riegels M, Hesse U & Grønbæk M. |access-date=2015-04-07}} raised its off premises purchase age from 15 to 16 years. * In November 2005 Switzerland passed its "Food and Commodities Regulation"{{cite web |url=http://www.admin.ch/opc/de/classified-compilation/20050153/index.html#a11 |title=Lebensmittel- und Gebrauchsgegenständeverordnung - Art. 11 |language=de |website=admin.ch |publisher=The Federal Authorities of the Swiss Confederation |access-date=2015-04-07}} (German: Lebensmittel- und Gebrauchsgegenständeverordnung), introducing a ban on alcohol sales to anyone under the age of 16, even though "Alcohol Law"{{cite web |url=http://www.admin.ch/opc/de/classified-compilation/19320035/index.html#a41 |title=Bundesgesetz über die gebrannten Wasser - Art. 41 |language=de |website=admin.ch |publisher=The Federal Authorities of the Swiss Confederation |access-date=2015-04-07}} (German: Alkoholgesetz) passed in 1980 already required a minimum age of 18 years for the retail sale of distilled spirits. Therefore, it is illegal to sell fermented alcohol (e.g. [[beer]], [[wine]], [[sparkling wine]] or [[cider]]) to anyone under the age of 16, and any distilled alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. Further the canton of Ticino introduced a cantonal law in 1989 banning all alcohol sales to anyone under the age of 18 years.{{cite web |url=http://www3.ti.ch/CAN/RLeggi/public/raccolta-leggi/legge/numero/6.1.1.1 |title=Legge sulla promozione della salute e il coordinamento sanitario (Legge sanitaria) - Art. 51 |language=it |website=ti.ch |access-date=2015-04-07}} * In 2006 the autonomous community [[Castile and León]]{{cite web |url=http://www.elconfidencial.com/ultima-hora-en-vivo/2012/07/legislacion-contra-botellon-manos-comunidades-autonomas-20120728-2508.html |title=La legislación contra el botellón en manos de las comunidades autónomas |date=2012 |language=es |website=ElConfidencial.com |access-date=2015-04-07}} raised its minimum purchase age from 16 to 18 years. * In late 2006, [[Gibraltar]]{{cite web |url=http://www.gibraltarlaws.gov.gi/articles/2006-11o.pdf |title=Children and Young Persons (Alcohol, Tobacco and Gaming) Act 2006 |date=2006 |website=gibraltarlaws.gov.gi |publisher=Government of Gibraltar |access-date=2015-04-07}} lawmakers passed the "''Children and Young Persons (Alcohol, Tobacco and Gaming) Act 2006''", which raised the minimum purchase age from 16 to 18 years. But the new law made an exception: minors aged 16 or 17 can purchase and consume on premises beer, wine or cider under 15% ABV or pre-packed containers of an alcoholic strength not exceeding 5.5% ABV (e.g. [[alcopops]]). * In 2009 [[France]]{{cite web |url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/actualite-france/2009/03/09/01016-20090309ARTFIG00563-les-deputes-interdisent-la-vente-d-alcool-aux-mineurs-.php |title=La vente d'alcool et de tabac interdite aux mineurs |author=Bastien Hugues |date=2009-03-09 |language=fr |website=lefigaro.fr |access-date=2015-04-07}} raised its minimum purchase age to 18 years, and fines were increased for selling or serving alcohol to a minor (up to 7,500 €). Previous to 2009 the minimum age to purchase any alcohol from off licensed premises was 16 years. In order to purchase alcohol on premises the minimum age was 16 years for low alcoholic beverages such as wine, beer, cider, perry, mead, crème de cassis and juices from fermented fruits or vegetables that contain 1.2 to 3° alcohol, natural sweet wines from controlled cultivation – to purchase or be served stronger alcoholic drinks one had to be 18 years of age. * In October 2009, the government of [[Malta]]{{cite web |url=http://livinginmalta.com/miscellaneuos/legal-drinking-age/ |title=Legal Drinking Age |author=Mark |date=2014-06-16 |website=livinginmalta.com |access-date=2015-04-07}} passed a new law raising its drinking and purchase age from 16 to 17 years. * In 2010 the autonomous community of [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] raised its minimum purchase age from 16 to 18 years.{{cite web |url=http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2010/06/17/espana/1276794476.html |title=Galicia elevará de 16 a 18 años la edad para beber y multará la venta a menores |author=Santiago de Compostela |date=2010-06-17 |language=es |website=elmundo.es |access-date=2015-04-07}} * In 2011 [[Denmark]]{{cite web |url=http://sundhedsstyrelsen.dk/da/sundhed/alkohol/lovgivning |title=Lovgivning på alkoholområdet |date=2014-01-22 |language=Danish|website=sundhedsstyrelsen.dk |publisher=Sundhedsstyrelsen |access-date=2015-04-07}} passed a new law, raising the minimum age for off-premises sale of alcohol >16.5% ABV to 18 years of age. The age to purchase alcohol <16.5% ABV remaines at 16. * [[Italy]] raised its minimum purchase age from 16 to 18 in 2012. Previously Italy did not have a purchase age for off-premises sales, and the minimum age of 16 years for on premises sales was barely enforced.{{cite web |url=http://www.ufficiocommercio.it/pf/testo-news/27926/Divieto-di-vendita-alcolici-ai-minori-di-anni-18 |title=Divieto di vendita alcolici ai minori di anni 18 |date=2012-11-14 |language=it |website=ufficiocommercio.it |publisher=Ufficio Commercio |access-date=2015-04-07}} * In 2013 the government of [[Portugal]] restricted alcohol sales to young people: distilled spirits can not be sold to anyone under the age of 18, and other alcohol (e.g. beer, wine or cider) can't be sold to anyone under the age of 16. Previously the minimum age for all kinds of alcoholic beverages was 16 years.{{cite web |url=http://www.ivv.min-agricultura.pt/np4/154?newsId=5684&fileName=NI_02_2013__27_05_2013_.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131107013535/http://www.ivv.min-agricultura.pt/np4/154?newsId=5684&fileName=NI_02_2013__27_05_2013_.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-11-07 |title=RESTRIÇÕES À DISPONIBILIZAÇÃO, VENDA E CONSUMO DE BEBIDAS ALCOÓLICAS - N.º02/2013 |author=Instituto da Vinha e do Vinho |date=2013-03-27 |language=pt |website=ivv.min-agricultura.pt |access-date=2015-04-07 }} * As of 1 January 2014, the minimum legal purchase and consumption age was raised from 16 to 18 in the [[Netherlands]]. Previously young people over the age of 16 could purchase and consume alcohol <15% ABV, and adults aged 18 and over could purchase alcohol over 15% ABV.{{cite web |url=http://www.rijksoverheid.nl/onderwerpen/alcohol/alcohol-in-de-wet |title=Alcohol in de wet |language=nl |website=rijksoverheid.nl |access-date=7 April 2015}} * As of March 2015, the autonomous community of [[Asturias]] raised its drinking age from 16 to 18 years. Asturias was Spain's last community with a drinking age of 16 years. The new law brings the drinking age into line with the rest of Spain.{{cite web |url=http://www.lne.es/asturias/2015/03/06/copas-saldran-caras-menores/1722639.html |title=Las copas saldrán caras a los menores |date=2015-03-06 |language=es |website=lne.es |access-date=2015-04-07}} * As of 1 January 2018, [[Lithuania]] raised its minimum drinking age from 18 to 20 years. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:90%;" |- ! rowspan=2 style="width:15%;"| Country ! rowspan=2 style="width:15%;"| State/region/province ! colspan=2 style="width:30%;"| [[De jure]] ! rowspan=2 style="width:40%;"| Notes |- ! style="width:15%;"| Drinking age ! style="width:15%;"| Purchase age |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Albania}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |18 | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Andorra}} |style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |18 | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Armenia}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=http://www.parliament.am/drafts.php?sel=showdraft&DraftID=4516&Reading=0|title=ՎԱՐՉԱԿԱՆ ԻՐԱՎԱԽԱԽՏՈՒՄՆԵՐԻ ՎԵՐԱԲԵՐՅԱԼ ՀԱՅԱՍՏԱՆԻ ՀԱՆՐԱՊԵՏՈՒԹՅԱՆ ՕՐԵՆՍԳԻՐՔ ԳԼՈՒԽ 19. - Հոդված 329. - 16., 17.|publisher=National Assembly|accessdate=22 March 2018|df=}} | There are no laws mandating alcohol vendors to ID potential underage drinkers. ID checks are very rarely, if ever, carried out |- | rowspan="2" | {{flag|Austria}} | {{flag|Burgenland}}

18 ([[distilled beverage]]s) | Carinthia also requires adolescents to maintain a blood alcohol level below 0.05%. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Azerbaijan}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://archive.bakupost.az/sosium/20131002094909678.html|title=Sosium – Siqaret qadağası gündəmdə|publisher=bakupost.az|accessdate=22 March 2018|df=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150103171132/http://archive.bakupost.az/sosium/20131002094909678.html|archivedate=3 January 2015}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal to sell or serve alcohol to a minor under 18 years of age. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Belarus}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://blr.belta.by/all_news/society/i_15238.html|title=МУС Беларусі прапануе забараніць курэнне і ўжыванне алкаголю для асоб, маладзейшых за 18 гадоў|publisher=blr.belta.bye|accessdate=22 March 2018|df=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141228144803/http://blr.belta.by/all_news/society/i_15238.html|archivedate=28 December 2014}} | align="center" |18 |The law prohibits the sale of alcohol to anyone under the age of 18 years. However, the law is rarely enforced. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Belgium}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |16 (beer, wine and cider)
18 (spirits){{cite web|url=http://www.jeunesetalcool.be/spip.php?rubrique71|title=Vente et consommation d’alcool en Belgique|date=|publisher=jeunesetalcool.be|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150218215057/http://jeunesetalcool.be/spip.php?rubrique71|archivedate=2015-02-18|deadurl=yes|accessdate=2014-12-31|df=}} | Since 10 January 2010, it is illegal to "sell, serve, or offer" any form of distilled alcohol to those under the age of 18 or any alcoholic drink to those under 16. So fermented drinks like beer or wine are permitted above 16. Previously, it was illegal to sell alcoholic drinks to under-16s, but accompanying adults could buy drinks for them. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Bosnia and Herzegovina}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web |url=http://novi-informator.net/prodaja-alkoholnih-pi%C4%87-osobama-mla%C4%91im-od-18-godina |title=Prodaja alkoholnih pića osobama mlađim od 18 godina |publisher=jeunesetalcool.be |date= |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | Selling alcohol to a minor under the age of 18 years is an offence. There is no minimum age to buy, attempt to buy or consume alcohol in public. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Czech Republic}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web |url=http://www.khsova.cz/01_legislativa/files/379_2005.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-01-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808050740/http://www.khsova.cz/01_legislativa/files/379_2005.pdf |archivedate=2014-08-08 |df= }} Collection of Laws of the Czech Criminal Code ([[Czech Republic]]). 379/2005 Sb. ZÁKON - ČÁST PRVNÍ Ochrana před škodami působenými tabákovými výrobky, alkoholem ajinými návykovými látkami § 11, § 12, § 14, § 15: Omezení prodeje a dovozu. Retrieved on 20. October 2014. | It is illegal to provide alcohol to minors{{cite web|url=http://portal.gov.cz/app/zakony/zakonPar.jsp?page=0&idBiblio=60445&recShow=12&nr=379~2F2005&rpp=15#parCnt|title=379/2005 Sb. - o opatřeních k ochraně před škodami působenými tabákovými výrobky, alkoholem a jinými návykovými látkami a o změně souvisejících zákonů - Text předpisu - Portál veřejné správy|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} (punishable by fine or up to 1{{cite web|url=http://zakony-online.cz/?s10&q10=204|title=Trestní zákoník (zákon č. 40/2009 Sb.) §204|publisher=}} or 2{{cite web|url=http://zakony-online.cz/?s10&q10=201|title=Trestní zákoník (zákon č. 40/2009 Sb.) §201|publisher=}} year(s) imprisonment). Consumption itself is not prohibited by law.{{cite web|url=http://www.vitalia.cz/clanky/policie-mame-vase-dite-pilo/|title=Policie: "Máme vaše dítě. Pilo."|author=Lenka Krbcová|date=23 September 2010|work=Vitalia.cz|accessdate=28 July 2015}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Denmark}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |16 (<16.5% [[ABV]])
18 (≥16.5% [[ABV]]) | While there is no age requirement for drinking alcohol in Denmark, there are laws that prevent minors from buying alcohol: * In order to buy alcohol above 1.2% and below 16.5% [[ABV]] in stores, one must be 16 years of age. * In order to buy alcohol above 16.5% [[ABV]] in stores, one must be 18 years of age.{{cite web |author=AF Cecilie Lund Kristiansen |url=http://politiken.dk/tjek/sundhedogmotion/ECE1217122/butikker-har-styr-paa-nye-alkohol-regler/ |title=Butikker har styr på nye alkohol-regler |language=da |publisher=Politiken.dk |date= |accessdate=2012-08-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121007103351/http://politiken.dk/tjek/sundhedogmotion/ECE1217122/butikker-har-styr-paa-nye-alkohol-regler/ |archivedate=2012-10-07 |df= }} By tradition, youths are privately allowed to drink alcohol after their [[confirmation]].{{cite web|url=http://alcoholcultureindenmark.webbyen.dk/ |title=Alcohol culture in Denmark |publisher=Alcoholcultureindenmark.webbyen.dk |date= |accessdate=2009-06-20}} If a shop or bar fails to ask for an ID card and is identified having sold alcohol to an underage, it is subject to fine. A national ID card, obtained in the local town hall, can serve as age verification.{{cite web|url=https://www.retsinformation.dk/Forms/R0710.aspx?id=9878 |title=Lov om forbud mod salg af tobak og alkohol til personer under 16 år |language=Danish|accessdate=2013-01-08}} This card is rarely used though since a passport or drivers license is more commonly used.[http://www.dr.dk/Nyheder/Indland/2006/07/01/.htm Få unge har købt legitimationskort] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111127114344/http://www.dr.dk/Nyheder/Indland/2006/07/01/.htm |date=2011-11-27 }}, Danmarks Radio, 01. July 2006 Both the legal drinking and purchasing age in the Faroe Islands is 18.{{citation needed|date=October 2017}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Estonia}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |18{{cite web|url=https://www.riigiteataja.ee/akt/832173|title=Alkoholiseadus|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. Alcohol found in possession of any child can be confiscated by the police. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Finland}} | style="text-align:left;" colspan="2" |18 (possession and purchase of 1.2–22% ABV)
20 (for possession and purchase of 23–80% ABV)
18 (for all in bars, clubs and restaurants){{cite web|url=http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/1994/19941143|title=Alkoholilaki 1143/1994 - Ajantasainen lainsäädäntö - FINLEX ®|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} | All major grocery chains have implemented a policy to ask for ID if the customer looks under 30.{{cite web |url=http://yle.fi/uutiset/if_you_look_under_30_get_your_id_out/6333481|title=If you look under 30, get your ID out|publisher=YLE News|date=2012-10-12|accessdate=2013-04-21}} Stores may refuse to sell alcohol if the customer is accompanied by a minor, or if proxy purchasing is suspected. Purchasing alcohol on behalf of a minor is a criminal offence.Rikoslaki 50a:1-3 Police may search minors in public places and confiscate or destroy any alcoholic beverages in their possession. Incidents are reported to the legal guardian and social authorities, who may intervene with child welfare procedures. In addition, those aged 15 or above are subject to a fine.{{cite web|url=http://www.finlex.fi/fi/laki/ajantasa/2010/20100756#P17|title=Laki rikesakkorikkomuksista 756/2010 - Ajantasainen lainsäädäntö - FINLEX ®|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} In private, offering alcohol to a minor is considered a criminal offence if it results in drunkenness and the act can be deemed reprehensible as a whole, considering the minor's age, degree of maturity and other circumstances. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|France}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18 | [[France]] has no explicitly stated consumption age,{{cite web|url=http://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/affichCodeArticle.do;jsessionid=18ED9AC9EF67D77F5A2C0373B8E6B783.tpdjo08v_1?cidTexte=LEGITEXT000006072665&idArticle=LEGIARTI000020895230&dateTexte=|title=Code de la santé publique - Article L3353-3 - Legifrance|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} but selling alcohol to a minor (under 18) is illegal{{cite web|url=http://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/affichCodeArticle.do;jsessionid=18ED9AC9EF67D77F5A2C0373B8E6B783.tpdjo08v_1?idArticle=LEGIARTI000020895233&cidTexte=LEGITEXT000006072665&dateTexte=20090920|title=Code de la santé publique - Article L3342-1 - Legifrance|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} and can be fined 7500 [[euro]]s. This age was raised from 16 to 18 in 2009.[http://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/affichTexteArticle.do;jsessionid=18ED9AC9EF67D77F5A2C0373B8E6B783.tpdjo08v_1?cidTexte=JORFTEXT000020879475&idArticle=LEGIARTI000020881176&dateTexte=20090920&categorieLien=id Law passed on 23 July 2009].[http://legifrance.gouv.fr/affichCodeArticle.do;jsessionid=EEA97DD8289FBEA8B0F379B642F59F2C.tpdjo10v_3?idArticle=LEGIARTI000006688129&cidTexte=LEGITEXT000006072665&dateTexte=20090722 French Public Health Code, Art L3353-4]. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Georgia|Georgia (country)}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite book |url=https://www.alcoshop.ge/?lang=ge&p=27 |title=გაფრთხილება |date=31 October 2008 |accessdate=22 March 2018}} | By Georgian law, the sale of alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years is prohibited. |- | colspan=2|{{flag|Germany}} | align="center" colspan="2"|14(beer, wine and cider if accompanied)
16 (beer, wine and cider)
18 (spirits and aliments containing spirits above negligible amounts){{cite book |url=http://www.bmfsfj.de/RedaktionBMFSFJ/Abteilung5/Pdf-Anlagen/jschg-englisch,property=pdf,bereich=bmfsfj,sprache=de,rwb=true.pdf |title=Protection of Young Persons Act, Amendment by Article 3, Act |date=31 October 2008 |accessdate=13 July 2017}} |It is illegal to sell, serve or supply fermented alcoholic beverages (beer, wine, cider and sparkling wine) to anyone under 16 years of age. However this age limit drops down to 14 if a minor is accompanied by his parent or legal guardian. It is generally illegal to serve, sell or supply any beverage containing spirits and aliments containing spirits above negligible amounts, to anyone under the age of 18 years. Violation of the "Protection of Young Persons Act" can be fined up to €50.000.
{{See also|Alcohol laws in Germany}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Gibraltar}} | align="center" | None | align="center" | 18
16 (beer, wine and cider) | It is illegal to sell alcoholic drinks to anyone under the age of 18, other than the following two exceptions. The minimum age to be served in licensed premises is 16 if:[http://www.gibraltarlaws.gov.gi/articles/2006-11o.pdf Children and Young Persons (Alcohol, Tobacco, and Gaming) Act 2006] (Gibraltar Laws). * The alcoholic beverage is beer, wine or cider below 15% [[ABV]], '''or''' * The alcoholic beverage is served in a bottle, or a pre-packaged container below 5.5% [[ABV]]. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Greece}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web|url=http://www.et.gr/idocs-nph/search/pdfViewerForm.html?args=5C7QrtC22wHtyK1ZYNhP8HdtvSoClrL8tPgYioSqM0V5MXD0LzQTLWPU9yLzB8V68knBzLCmTXKaO6fpVZ6Lx3UnKl3nP8NxdnJ5r9cmWyJWelDvWS_18kAEhATUkJb0x1LIdQ163nV9K--td6SIuRTBcwAJX_MtAI12AuQxmk_d_VIhoTZ3160crsjOSqae |title=Protection of minors ΦΕΚ A 262/2008 |publisher=www.nt.gr National Printing Office |date=2008-12-23}} | In 2008, the consumption of alcoholic beverages was prohibited for minors in public. However, the law does not apply to private events or private premises. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Hungary}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |18 | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Iceland}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |20[http://www.res.is/is/page/practical_information Practical Information] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090218032743/http://www.res.is/is/page/practical_information |date=2009-02-18 }} School for Renewable Energy Science, Icelandhttps://www.althingi.is/altext/stjt/1998.075.html "Alcohol Act", Parliamentary Document 1558, 122. Legislative Assembly 478. Act: Alcohol Act (Total Law ). Act no. 75, 15 June 1998. | Possession or consumption of alcohol by minors is not an offence, but supplying them with alcohol is. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Ireland}} | align="center" |None (on private residence with permission from parents or guardians){{Cite web|url=http://www.citizensinformation.ie/en/reference/checklists/checklist_at_what_age_can_i.html|title=At what age can I?|website=www.citizensinformation.ie|language=en|access-date=2017-02-28}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal for minors to buy alcohol or for a third party to attempt to buy it for minors. It is illegal to purchase alcohol for anybody under the age of consent without permission from their guardians.{{cite web|url=http://www.citizensinformation.ie/en/justice/criminal_law/criminal_offences/alcohol_and_the_law.html |title=Alcohol and the law |publisher=Citizensinformation.ie |date=2012-03-07 |accessdate=2012-08-11}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Italy}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite news|title=Vietata la vendita di alcolici ai minori di anni 18: emanata la legge |url=http://www.asaps.it/39206-Vietata_la_vendita_di_alcolici_ai_minori_di_anni_18:_emanata_la_legge.html |accessdate=2015-01-09 |publisher=asaps.it |date=17 February 2013}} | In 2012 the then Health Minister Renato Balduzzi proposed to raise the age to 18.{{cite web|url=http://www.trovanorme.salute.gov.it/norme/dettaglioAtto.spring?id=43801&completo=true|title=Trova Norme & Concorsi - Normativa Sanitaria|author=Istituto Poligrafico e Zecca dello Stato S.p.A.|publisher=|accessdate=28 July 2015}} Selling alcohol to those under the age of 18 in shops carries a fine between €250 and €1000. Serving alcoholic beverages to those under the age of 16 is a criminal offense and is punished with prison up to one year, if the individual is 16 or 17 it will be treated as an offense that is fined between €250 and €1000 ''(Legge n. 189/2013)''. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Kosovo}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |None{{citation needed|date=March 2018}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Latvia}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite news|title=Alkoholisko dzērienu aprites likums |url=http://likumi.lv/doc.php?id=88009 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |publisher=likumi.lv|date=May 1, 2004}} | It is illegal to sell or serve alcoholic beverages to any minor under the age of 18 years. There is no minimum age to consume or possess alcohol. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Liechtenstein}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |16 beer, wine and cider
18 spirits and spirit-based beverages | Wine, beer and ciders as well as some other party drinks sometimes without spirits may be purchased by the age of 16. Spirits as well as alcopops may be sold only to people at least 18.{{cite web |url=http://www.gesetze.li/get_pdf.jsp?PDF=.pdf |title=Jugendgesetz vom 19. Dezember 1979 |publisher=Gesetze.li |date= |accessdate=2009-06-20 }}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Lithuania}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |20{{cite news|title=Seimas adopted amendments on reduction of alcohol consumption|accessdate=2017-06-01|publisher=Parliament of Lithuania (lrs.lt)|url=http://www.lrs.lt/sip/portal.show?p_r=119&p_k=2&p_t=173762&data_nuo=06%2F01%2F2017&data_iki=06%2F02%2F2017}} | It is illegal to sell, serve or supply alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 20 years. Persons under the age of 20 are prohibited from consuming alcoholic beverages or from possessing them. The minimum age was raised from 18 to 20 in 2018. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Luxembourg}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |16{{cite web|url=http://legilux.public.lu/eli/etat/leg/loi/2006/12/22/n11/jo |title=RECUEIL DE LEGISLATION - A –– N° 237 29 décembre 2006 |publisher=legilux.public.lu |date=2006-09-29 |accessdate=2014-06-02}} | It is illegal to sell or serve alcoholic beverages >1.2% ABV to any person under the age of 16 years. Violation is fined €251 to €1.000. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Macedonia}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |18{{cite web|url=https://inovativnost.mk/2018/01/16/%D0%BE%D0%B4-%D0%BC%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%82-%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%85%D0%BE%D0%BB-%D1%9C%D0%B5-%D1%81%D0%B5-%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%B4%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%B0-%D0%B8-%D0%BF%D0%BE-19-%D1%87%D0%B0%D1%81%D0%BE/ |title=Од март алкохол ќе се продава и по 19 часот |publisher=inovativnost.mk |accessdate=22 March 2018}} | Must show an ID card upon request. In certain smaller places, such as family-owned convenience stores and street kiosks, there is little to no enforcement on how old or young somebody purchases alcohol. There is little to no enforcement for drinking privately, but drinking in bars may require an ID. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Malta}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2" |17{{cite web|url=http://malta.cc/maltese-society/legal-drinking-age-malta/ |title=Legal Drinking Age in Malta - Buying Alcohol from Bars - Malta Blog |publisher=Malta.cc |date=2009-12-29 |accessdate=2012-08-11}} | Must provide identification upon request. |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Moldova}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://lex.justice.md/viewdoc.php?action=view&view=doc&id=334893&lang=1 |title=LEGE Nr. 1100 din 30.06.2000 cu privire la fabricarea şi circulaţia alcoolului etilic şi a producţiei alcoolice - Art. 30 |publisher=lex.justice.md |date=15 October 2010|accessdate=22 March 2018}} | align="center" |18 | It is illegal to sell, or serve alcoholic beverages to anyone under the age of 18 years. It is not illegal for minors to buy, attempt to buy or consume alcohol. The minimum purchase age was raised from 16 to 18 in 2012.[Art.30 lit.j) în redacţia LP22 din 01.03.12, MO92/15.05.12 art.290] |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Montenegro}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2"|18{{citation needed|date=March 2018}} | |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Netherlands}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2"|18 | The legal age for purchasing and consumption of alcoholic beverages was raised from 16 to 18 since 2014. Alcohol is commonly available upon parental permission. Selling alcoholic beverages to people under 18 is illegal, buying alcoholic beverages for someone else under the age of 18 is also illegal.{{citation needed|date=October 2017}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Norway}} | align="center" |None{{cite web|url=http://www.regjeringen.no/nb/dep/aid/dok/regpubl/otprp/19961997/Otprp-nr-7-1996-97-/16/3.html?id=299088 |title=Proposition to Odelstinget rejecting the idea of holding minors criminally responsible for the purchase or consumption of alcohol |publisher=Regjeringen.no |date= |accessdate=2009-06-20}} | align="center" |18 (<22%)
20 (≥22% [[ABV]]) | Selling alcohol to or buying alcohol for minors is illegal. Minors are defined as under 18 for beer and wine, under 20 for drinks that contain 22% [[ABV]] or more. Minors who buy alcohol are not held criminally responsible; instead, the crime lies with those who sold it or obtained it for them. Alcohol with more than 60% [[ABV]] is generally not sold in Norway, although exceptions may be made by the government for specific products.{{cite web|url=http://lovdata.no/dokument/NL/lov/1989-06-02-27#%C2%A78-13|title=Alkoholloven §8-13}} Alcohol possessed by minors may be confiscated as evidence. Drinking in public is prohibited, though this is rarely enforced in recreational areas.{{cite web|url=http://oslopuls.aftenposten.no/restaurant_uteliv/article233583.ece|title=Police: It's okay to drink in public parks|publisher=Aftenposten|date=2009-07-02|accessdate=2011-08-02|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100503064136/http://oslopuls.aftenposten.no/restaurant_uteliv/article233583.ece|archivedate=2010-05-03|df=}} |- | colspan=2| {{flag|Poland}} | align="center" |None | align="center" |18{{cite web |url=http://static1.money.pl/d/akty_prawne/pdf/DU/2002/147/DU20021471231.pdf |title=USTAWA z dnia 26 października 1982 r. o wychowaniu w trzeźwości i przeciwdziałaniu alkoholizmowi. (tekst jednolity: Dz. U. 2002 r. Nr 147 poz. 1231) |language=Polish |accessdate=2014-03-30}} | Article 15 of The Act on Upbringing in Sobriety and Counteracting Alcoholism{{cite web |url=http://www.parpa.pl/download/ustawaang.pdf |title=The Act on Upbringing in Sobriety and Counteracting Alcoholism. |language=English |accessdate=2016-07-10}} clearly states that buyers or persons being served must be at least 18 and prove it with ID if they look like they may not be at least that age. There is no mention of consumption age in this or any other act in Poland. | align="left" | None (less than 2.25% [[ABV]])
18 (bars and restaurants)
18 (2.25%–3.5% ABV in food shops)
20 ([[Systembolaget]] shops),{{cite web |url=http://www.systembolaget.se/Applikationer/Knappar/InEnglish/Rules+on+selling.htm |title=Systembolaget - Rules on selling |publisher=Systembolaget.se |date= |accessdate=2009-06-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090116122318/http://www.systembolaget.se/Applikationer/Knappar/InEnglish/Rules+on+selling.htm |archivedate=2009-01-16 |df= }} |{{See also|Alcohol in Sweden}}It is legal for anyone at any age to drink, but it is illegal to supply anyone under the age of 20, any beverage containing more than 3.5%ABV, and supply anyone under the age of 18 beer containing more than 2.25%ABV, except in a venue licensed to sell alcohol, who are allowed to sell alcohol to anyone over 18. It is also legal to serve an underage person alcohol in a private place, provided it's a limited amount and done in moderation.{{cite web|url=https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/alkohollag-20101622_sfs-2010-1622|title=3 Kap. 7§ Alkohollag (2010:1622)|publisher=|accessdate=27 June 2018}} The reason for lower limit in bars than in Systembolaget shops is that bartenders have a legal responsibility for how drunk a guest gets. |- | rowspan="2" | {{flag|Switzerland}} |{{flag|Switzerland}} (federal law) | align="center" |None
(See notes) | align="left" |16 (fermented alcoholic drinks with less than 15% ABV and natural wines with less than 18% ABV){{cite web|url=http://www.admin.ch/opc/de/classified-compilation/20050153/index.html#a11 |title=817.02 Lebensmittel- und Gebrauchsgegenständeverordnung Art. 11 |publisher=admin.ch |date= |accessdate=2015-01-09}}
18 (spirits) {{cite web|url=http://www.admin.ch/opc/de/classified-compilation/19320035/index.html#a41 |title=680 Bundesgesetz über die gebrannten Wasser Art. 41 IV. 1. i. |publisher=admin.ch |date= |accessdate=2015-01-09}} | Whoever offers or supplies alcoholic beverages to a child under the age of 16 years in an amount which is harmful to one's health is punished with imprisonment up to 3 years or a fine.{{cite web |url=https://www.admin.ch/opc/de/classified-compilation/19370083/201501010000/311.0.pdf |title=311.0 Schweizerisches Strafgesetzbuch vom 21. Dezember 1937 (Stand am 1. Juni 1932 über die gebrannten Wasser (Alkoholgesetz) - Art. 57 |author= |date= |language=de |website=admin.ch |page= |publisher=Swiss Federal Council |access-date=2015-08-09}} |- | {{flag|Ticino}} | colspan="2" align="center" |18 | The canton [[Ticino]] prohibits selling and consumption of any type of alcohol by minors under the age of 18. {{flag|Wales}} | style="text-align:center;" colspan="2"| 18{{cite web|url=http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/17/section/150|title=Licensing Act 2003 section 150|publisher=|accessdate=22 October 2015}}
16 (beer, wine or cider with meal)
